rationale: The species is only known from the type series, collected from Baisha Town, Jiande County, Zhejiang Province (China), inhabiting mountain streams. As no further records are known, the range of the species remains unknown. As such it is considered to be Data Deficient.

The subspecies is only known from specimens collected prior to 1938 (Kubo 1938) from  Huzan Fish market (Korea), it is currently not clear if this town is  situated in the republic of Korea or the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.  As the specimens were obtained from a fish market, the habitat of the species is not known.  As such it is considered to be Data Deficient.

The taxon is only know with certainty from one area (Luoyang) in Henan  Province and two areas (Huizhou, Ningguo) in Anhui Province, China.  The habitat in which it occurs is mountain streams.  As the wider distribution of the taxon is not known, nor are any potential threats to it known, it is considered to be Data Deficient.

The two Chinese subspecies are only known from four scattered records in Zhejiang, Henan and Anhui Provinces (China) (Liang 2004), whilst the Korean subspecies is only known from specimens purchased at Huzan fish market, prior to 1938 (Kubo 1938).  It is unclear if  Huzan is situated in the Republic of Korea or the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.  As the distribution and ecology of the species are poorly known, it is considered to be Data Deficient.
